intro: Synthyris missurica subsp. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy synthyris, is a perennial herb native to the central and northern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its hairy, often glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its subspecific name, *hirsuta*, refers to its hairy appearance, distinguishing it from other members of the species.
